baumol_cost_disease.name: Baumol Cost Disease / Stored Energy
baumol_cost_disease.description: Sectors where wages rose with the economy but productivity did NOT have the most 'stored energy' for AI disruption. Higher stored energy = more potential for cost collapse.

discoveries.description: Identified professional services as high Baumol energy
Veterinary services has highest Baumol in healthcare subsectors
Translation/localization had high Baumol but killed by density
EU Labour Cost Index confirms Baumol across geographies
Bottom-up screener found 933 sectors ranked by Baumol - wholesale brokers (1.73x), management consulting (1.82x) as new candidates

bass_diffusion_scurve.name: Bass Diffusion S-Curve Positioning
bass_diffusion_scurve.description: Estimates where AI adoption is on the S-curve for a given sector. Position determines strategy: pre-takeoff (evangelize), takeoff (ride), late majority (differentiate), laggards (skip).

discoveries.description: Veterinary AI in early-adopter phase (optimal entry window)
Customer support AI in early-majority (growth accelerating)

null_results.notes: Applied to healthcare staffing - position unclear due to regulatory distortion

hhi_market_concentration.name: Herfindahl-Hirschman Index
hhi_market_concentration.description: Market concentration measure. HHI < 1500 = fragmented (platform opportunity), 1500-2500 = moderate, > 2500 = concentrated (hard entry).

discoveries.description: Property management concentrated (RealPage+Yardi >60%) - killed opportunity
Surveying duopoly (Trimble+Hexagon 60%+) - killed opportunity

null_results.notes: Applied to veterinary services but no clean market share data available at sub-industry level

competitive_density_scan.name: Competitive Density Web Scan
competitive_density_scan.description: Web search for AI startups, VC funding, and incumbents targeting a specific sector. Rating: LOW/MEDIUM/HIGH/SATURATED.

discoveries.description: Construction AI saturated ($3-5B+) - killed opportunity
Translation saturated ($2-4B+) - killed opportunity
Freight brokerage saturated ($5-8B+) - killed opportunity
Insurance brokerage moderate-crowded ($3-5B+) - parked
Veterinary services sparse ($200-400M) - only exception to density gate
Staffing industry saturated ($5B+) - rejected as opportunity
12-sector scan: wholesale brokers LOW density, legal SATURATED ($4.3B), portfolio mgmt SATURATED

macro_indicator_screening.name: FRED/BLS Macro Indicator Screening
macro_indicator_screening.description: Pull macro indicators (GDP, employment, wages, productivity, credit, JOLTS) from FRED and BLS to identify structural shifts.

discoveries.description: Professional services employment declining (-97K) while healthcare growing (+709K)
JOLTS gap -966K confirming structural labor shortage
Bankruptcy surge 76% YoY confirming liquidation cascade
Beveridge Curve r=-0.658 confirming structural mismatch

null_results.notes: GDP data too aggregated to identify sector-specific opportunities
Credit data showed tightening but couldn't connect to specific sectors
Productivity data at 2-digit NAICS too coarse
Same indicators, marginal new signal vs prior cycles

edgar_filing_analysis.name: EDGAR SEC Filing Analysis
edgar_filing_analysis.description: Analyze 10-K/10-Q filings for AI mentions, labor cost disclosures, and sector-specific signals.

discoveries.description: PE roll-up firms (Crete, Ascend) showing acquisition patterns in accounting
Staffing company filings (RHI, MAN, KELYA) confirming labor market deterioration

null_results.notes: 10-K AI mentions too generic to differentiate sectors

equity_market_signals.name: Equity Market / ETF Price Signals
equity_market_signals.description: Use stock prices and ETF performance as leading indicators. Staffing stocks, sector ETFs, PE-exposed equities.

discoveries.description: Staffing canary: RHI -51%, MAN -39%, KELYA -20% — professional labor depreciation priced by markets
Healthcare ETF +20% confirming P2+P5 divergence corridor
Professional-vs-industrial gradient reveals specificity of disruption

timing_arbitrage_analysis.name: P7 Timing Arbitrage / Vacuum Analysis
timing_arbitrage_analysis.description: Identify gaps between companies cutting human capacity and AI's actual ability to replace those functions. Klarna reversal as canonical example.

discoveries.description: Customer support vacuum hypothesis formed
Klarna reversal + CNet errors + Air Canada liability confirm premature cuts
DOGE workforce reductions creating federal services vacuum

counter_signal_research.name: Counter-Signal / Bear Case Research
counter_signal_research.description: Deliberately search for reasons an opportunity will FAIL. Counter-signals weighted 1.5x in grading.

discoveries.description: Healthcare staffing AI killed — nurse ratio manipulation illegal
Back-office SMB killed — Intuit moat + Bench/Pilot failure precedent
Freight brokerage killed — Convoy $900M failure at 100-1000x our capital
Vet services Mars/IDEXX threat identified (not yet fatal)

null_results.notes: Counter-signals for construction opportunity unclear at the time
Customer support counter-signals found (Klarna reversal) but interpreted as supporting vacuum thesis

international_comparison.name: International Comparative Data (Eurostat, OECD, World Bank)
international_comparison.description: Use international data to confirm US-specific patterns or identify geographic arbitrage. NOT for relocation — for bias-checking.

discoveries.description: UAE tight labor + Germany Baumol benchmarks confirm US-specific structural patterns

null_results.notes: 7 of 9 international connectors returned empty data
Eurostat, OECD data too aggregated for sub-industry analysis
World Bank 16-country dataset not yet processed into actionable signals

composite_index_construction.name: Composite Index Construction
composite_index_construction.description: Build multi-indicator composite indices (P3 Cost Collapse, Capital Environment, Beveridge Curve) from normalized components.

discoveries.description: P3 Cost Collapse Index at 100.0 (MAXIMUM) — all components at most favorable
Capital Environment Index at 100.0 — dual maximum creates P-008 convergence pattern
Beveridge Curve r=-0.658 confirms structural (not cyclical) mismatch

llm_brainstorm_candidates.name: LLM Brainstorming for Sector Candidates
llm_brainstorm_candidates.description: Use the LLM's knowledge to brainstorm potential sectors/opportunities. The original (and only) discovery method for Cycles 1-8.

discoveries.description: Initial sector list: healthcare staffing, back-office, construction, professional services
Veterinary services identified as unique low-density opportunity
Customer support vacuum hypothesis
LATAM nearshoring + AI augmentation frame

null_results.notes: Same sectors as Cycle 1, no new candidates
Re-scored existing candidates, no new sectors
Translation/freight added but immediately killed by density
Staffing industry identified as opportunity but rejected — signal not entry point

bottom_up_screener.name: Bottom-Up BLS/Census Sector Screener
bottom_up_screener.description: Mechanically screen all NAICS sub-industries using BLS QCEW employment/wage data, Census CBP establishment counts, and BEA productivity. Composite score: Baumol + size + fragmentation.

discoveries.description: Screened 933 6-digit NAICS sectors. Found wholesale trade brokers (425120) as LOW-density, high-fragmentation candidate never previously considered
Revealed that top-scoring sectors by Baumol (finance, tech) are all SATURATED — confirming P-006 Universal Gate from a completely independent methodology

io_table_propagation.name: Input-Output Table Disruption Propagation
io_table_propagation.description: Trace how disruption in one industry propagates to downstream industries through supply chain linkages. Built but never applied to real data.

shift_share_decomposition.name: Shift-Share Employment Decomposition
shift_share_decomposition.description: Separate national, industry, and regional effects on employment changes. Answers: is decline due to national trends, industry trends, or region-specific factors?

geographic_arbitrage.name: Geographic Wage/Cost Arbitrage Analysis
geographic_arbitrage.description: Compare US labor costs with international alternatives to identify arbitrage opportunities (LATAM, Asia, EU).

discoveries.description: LATAM nearshoring opportunity: 3-5x wage gap with improving infrastructure
Cross-border arbitrage amplified by composite index convergence

null_results.notes: Asia/Middle East comparison too distant from founding conditions to be actionable

meta.description: Methodology tracker for research engine. Uses Thompson Sampling to balance exploration (try uncertain methods) vs exploitation (use proven methods). Each methodology has a Beta distribution representing discovery probability.
meta.exploration_budget: 20% of cycle capacity reserved for low-confidence methodologies
meta.key_insight: The engine's discovery bottleneck was that it only had ONE discovery method (LLM brainstorming) which exhausted after Cycle 3. Adding the bottom-up screener in Cycle 9 immediately produced new candidates. The tracker ensures we systematically try and evaluate new approaches rather than relying on a single exhausted method.
